content.description:
This ascends a thin face followed by a fun arete. The arete alone makes a good 5.8 that can be climbed from the ledge left of

Icarus

.

P1. 5.10d. Climb the face past 4 bolts, then step up to the arete, and follow it to the anchors.
content.location: Start on the lower right face left of a 5.7 crack/dihedral.

content.description:
Climb a large, overhanging dihedral to fun face.

P1. 5.10b/c. Stem up the height-dependent, overhanging dihedral, then head up the face stepping right between the sixth and seventh bolts then back left (straight up is mid .11) to chain anchors.

From the anchors, a 70m rope will barely reach the ground below the ramp.
content.location: Scramble up the ramp from the lower left side of the crag to a large, overhanging, right-facing dihedral.

content.description:
P1. 5.9+. Clip the first bolt from the top of the chockstone, then climb fun face and crack to the anchors shared with

Sunkist

.

From the anchors, a 70m rope barely reaches the ground below the ramp.
content.location: Climb the ramp from the lower left side of the face to a large chockstone.  The route starts off the chockstone.

content.description:
This has fabulous arete climbing, if it was just a bit longer....

P1. 5.11a/b. Angle into the first bolt from the right, then make thoughtful moves on positive holds directly up the arete to the anchors.
content.location: This ascends the arete on the upper right side of the crag.

content.description:
A monster, rope chopping flake was pulled off while cleaning the route....

P1. 5.10b. Stem up to a large horizontal, angle left at the first bolt, then move back right and follow bolts up the face to anchors shared with

Icarus

.
content.location:
This is on the face right of the

Icarus

arete.
